channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024050412
item.description:
Report E-2024050412

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of cupric sulfate was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 434 pounds of product to the trailer interior and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Rose Rock Environmental (RRE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew used a pressure washer and absorbents to remediate the site and containerized all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum. RRE personnel transferred the contents of the damaged tote.
